reports.title: About this document
reports.query:
The purpose of this document is to facilitate delivery of data from a supplier by describing the data file structure and content requirements. It is a template that should be adapted to each study according to the template guidance text. If you are in doubt about how to use the template, please contact your Project CDP.




This template is aligned with NN Master Model version 3.3-NN02. If you use the template with another Master Model version, please consider if adjustments are needed (consult the SDTM Programmer).

reports.title: Text colour codes
reports.query:
WITH apoc.map.fromLists(['Black text','Red text','Green text'],["Mandatory to be included without changes.
Exception: Sheets, file names and sections that are not relevant for the supplier should be deleted according to the sheet instructions below and guidance on the individual sheets.", "Text that should be edited manually.
Include as is or modify/delete text according to study and change to black text.","Internal guidance text, which should be deleted before finalisation of the document."]) as guide_text
UNWIND keys(guide_text) as text_color
RETURN text_color as `Text color`, guide_text[text_color] as Instruction

reports.title: Dynamic text
reports.query:
MATCH (n0:StudyRoot {uid:$neodash_studyroot_uid})-[r1:LATEST]->(n1:StudyValue)
WITH CASE WHEN (n1.study_number is not null and n1.study_acronym is not null) THEN (n1.study_id_prefix + '-'+n1.study_number+ " [" + n1.study_acronym + "]") ELSE CASE WHEN n1.study_acronym is null THEN (n1.study_id_prefix + '-'+n1.study_number) ELSE (n1.study_id_prefix + " [" + n1.study_acronym + "]") END END AS Value
RETURN DISTINCT "Study ID" AS Label,Value
UNION
MATCH (n0:StudyRoot {uid:$neodash_studyroot_uid})
WITH CASE WHEN COALESCE(
  NULLIF($neodash_lab_supplier_name, ""),
  NULLIF($neodash_lab_supplier___manual, "")) is null  THEN "To be provided" ELSE COALESCE(
  NULLIF($neodash_lab_supplier_name, ""),
  NULLIF($neodash_lab_supplier___manual, "")) END as Value 
RETURN DISTINCT "LAB Supplier name" AS Label, Value
UNION
MATCH (n0:StudyRoot {uid:$neodash_studyroot_uid})
WITH CASE WHEN COALESCE(
  NULLIF($neodash_pk_supplier_name, ""),
  NULLIF($neodash_pk_supplier___manual, "")) is null  THEN "To be provided" ELSE COALESCE(
  NULLIF($neodash_pk_supplier_name, ""),
  NULLIF($neodash_pk_supplier___manual, "")) END as Value 
RETURN DISTINCT "PK Supplier name" AS Label, Value
UNION
MATCH (n0:StudyRoot {uid:$neodash_studyroot_uid})
WITH CASE WHEN COALESCE(
  NULLIF($neodash_ab_supplier_name, ""),
  NULLIF($neodash_ab_supplier___manual, "")) is null  THEN "To be provided" ELSE COALESCE(
  NULLIF($neodash_ab_supplier_name, ""),
  NULLIF($neodash_ab_supplier___manual, "")) END as Value 
RETURN DISTINCT "AB Supplier name" AS Label, Value
UNION
MATCH (n0:StudyRoot {uid:$neodash_studyroot_uid})
WITH CASE WHEN $neodash_document_version=""  THEN "To be provided" ELSE $neodash_document_version END as Value 
RETURN DISTINCT "Document version" AS Label, Value
UNION
MATCH (n0:StudyRoot {uid:$neodash_studyroot_uid})
RETURN DISTINCT "Document date" AS Label,date() AS Value

reports.title: Instructions
reports.query:
Replace the "To be provided" text in the 'Type dynmaic text panel':

• Study ID: Study ID selected. The study ID will automatically be reflected in the other sheets where the study ID is referenced.

• Supplier name: Either select from the Library of predefined Suppliers or insert name of supplier as specified in the column 'Short Supplier Name' in the document 'List of MFT suppliers'.

• Document version: Enter the version that should be shown in the document header.

• Document date: Todays date Will be shown in the document header.

reports.title: Select Study (required)
reports.query:
MATCH (n1:StudyRoot)-[:LATEST]->(n2:StudyValue)
WITH n1, CASE WHEN (n2.study_number is not null and n2.study_acronym is not null) THEN (n2.study_id_prefix + '-'+n2.study_number+ " [" + n2.study_acronym + "]") ELSE CASE WHEN n2.study_acronym is null THEN (n2.study_id_prefix + '-'+n2.study_number) ELSE (n2.study_id_prefix + " [" + n2.study_acronym + "]") END END AS StudyRef
RETURN DISTINCT 'Select' as Click,  StudyRef, n1.uid AS __uid

reports.title: Type dynamic text
Select lab specification version (mandatory)
reports.query:
MATCH (model_root:DataModelIGRoot)-->(n:DataModelIGValue)
-[:HAS_DATASET]->(dataset_value:DatasetInstance)<--(:Dataset {uid: "LAB"})
WHERE toLower(apoc.text.join([n.`name`,'(v',n.version_number,')'],"")) CONTAINS toLower($input) 
RETURN DISTINCT apoc.text.join([n.`name`,'(v',n.version_number,')'],"") as value, apoc.text.join([n.`name`,'(v',n.version_number,')'],"") as display ORDER BY size(toString(value)) ASC LIMIT 5

reports.title: Select Lab Supplier
reports.query:
match(n:DataSupplierValue)-[:HAS_TYPE]->(context:CTTermContext)-[:HAS_SELECTED_TERM]->(ct_root:CTTermRoot)<-[:HAS_TERM_ROOT]-(supp_type:CTCodelistTerm) where supp_type.submission_value='LAB DATA EXCHANGE FILES' 
WITH n
WHERE toLower(toString(n.`name`)) CONTAINS toLower($input) 
RETURN DISTINCT n.`name` as value,  n.`name` as display ORDER BY size(toString(value)) ASC LIMIT 100

reports.title: Select PK Supplier
reports.query:
match(n:DataSupplierValue)-[:HAS_TYPE]->(context:CTTermContext)-[:HAS_SELECTED_TERM]->(ct_root:CTTermRoot)<-[:HAS_TERM_ROOT]-(supp_type:CTCodelistTerm) where supp_type.submission_value='LAB DATA EXCHANGE FILES' 
WITH n
WHERE toLower(toString(n.`name`)) CONTAINS toLower($input) 
RETURN DISTINCT n.`name` as value,  n.`name` as display ORDER BY size(toString(value)) ASC LIMIT 100

reports.title: Select AB Supplier
reports.query:
match(n:DataSupplierValue)-[:HAS_TYPE]->(context:CTTermContext)-[:HAS_SELECTED_TERM]->(ct_root:CTTermRoot)<-[:HAS_TERM_ROOT]-(supp_type:CTCodelistTerm) where supp_type.submission_value='LAB DATA EXCHANGE FILES' 
WITH n
WHERE toLower(toString(n.`name`)) CONTAINS toLower($input) 
RETURN DISTINCT n.`name` as value,  n.`name` as display ORDER BY size(toString(value)) ASC LIMIT 100

reports.title: Visits
reports.query:
MATCH (n0:StudyRoot {uid:$neodash_studyroot_uid})-->(n1:StudyValue)-[r1:HAS_STUDY_VISIT]->(n2:StudyVisit)-[r2:HAS_VISIT_NAME]->(n3:VisitNameRoot)-->(n4:VisitNameValue)
WITH n4, n2, toInteger(n2.unique_visit_number) as visit_order
WITH n4,n2 order by visit_order
RETURN DISTINCT
n4.name AS `Visit label in protocol`, 
"To be provided" AS `Visit label in supplier database`,
n2.short_visit_label AS `Visit in data file`

reports.title: Study selected
reports.query:
MATCH (n0:StudyRoot {uid:$neodash_studyroot_uid})-[r1:LATEST]->(n1:StudyValue)
WITH CASE WHEN (n1.study_number is not null and n1.study_acronym is not null) THEN (n1.study_id_prefix + '-'+n1.study_number+ " [" + n1.study_acronym + "]") ELSE CASE WHEN n1.study_acronym is null THEN (n1.study_id_prefix + '-'+n1.study_number) ELSE (n1.study_id_prefix + " [" + n1.study_acronym + "]") END END AS Value
RETURN DISTINCT Value

reports.title: Spec Version selected
reports.query: return $neodash_lab_specification_version

reports.title: Data file specification for laboratory findings
reports.query:
LAB data description: Laboratory data such as haematology, biochemistry, urinalysis and laboratory biomarkers.

- All columns listed in the table below should be present in the data file and their order should not be changed. 
- For columns that are not applicable, the column header should remain, and the content in the column should be set to NULL (i.e. left blank) in each record in the file. 
-  The data file header line with the pipe-delimited column headers is shown for your reference below.
- The instructions in 'Mandatory/optional' specify if it is mandatory to populate a column. [Exceptions from this can, in rare cases, be agreed with the supplier while preparing the data specification.]
[Addition of study-specific data file columns to the specification should be discussed in an Implementation Group meeting. If additional data file columns are required, e.g. QNAMs, please add the additional columns as new rows at the end of this table and ensure to add the extra columns to the relevant tables in DMW for the study. If an added column should  be compliant with a codelist, please add the data file column to the content sheet so that relevant codelist submission values can be communicated to the supplier.
In Phase I studies, it can be relevant to add SEX for the subject's gender and DOB for the date of birth, which can be partial depending on the country. These columns can be used for checks in CDMS and will not be mapped to SDTM.]
- For codelist-controlled columns, supplier values should be mapped to the corresponding CDISC codelist values or to Novo Nordisk-defined additions to the codelists that are extensible. See the relevant codelist values as well as study-specific file content in the 'LAB, content' sheet. 
- The data types specified in the table below are the Oracle database data types that the data will be loaded into. VARCHAR2 stores alphanumeric strings.

The maximum length is specified for each column. Data type NUMBER stores numeric data.


Data file header line:
STUDYID|DOMAIN|SITE|SUBJID|FSUBJID|VISIT|LBREFID|TOPICCD|SUPTEST|LBORRES|UNITCOLL|LBORNRLO|LBORNRHI|LBNRIND|LBSTAT|LBREASND|LBNAM|LBLOINC|LOINCVER|LBSPEC|LBSPCCND|LBMETHOD|LBANMETH|LBFAST|LBDTC|LBTPT|SUBEVNUM|COMMENTALL

reports.title: LAB, structure
reports.query:
MATCH
  (model_root:DataModelIGRoot)-->
  (model_value:DataModelIGValue)-[:HAS_DATASET]->
  (dataset_value:DatasetInstance)<--
  (:Dataset {uid: "LAB"})
WHERE
  toLower(
    apoc.text.join(
      [model_value.name, '(v', model_value.version_number, ')'],
      ""
    )) =
  toLower($neodash_lab_specification_version)
MATCH
  (dataset_value)-[rel:HAS_DATASET_VARIABLE]->
  (variable_value:DatasetVariableInstance)<--
  (variable_root:DatasetVariable)
WHERE rel.version_number = model_value.version_number
OPTIONAL MATCH
  (variable_value)-->
  (var_class_inst:VariableClassInstance)<--
  (var_class:VariableClass)-->
  (sponModVarClasInst:SponsorModelVariableClassInstance)
WITH
  variable_root,
  variable_value,
  var_class_inst,
  var_class,
  sponModVarClasInst,
  apoc.text.split(rel.ordinal, "\.") AS split_ordinal
ORDER BY toInteger(split_ordinal[0]), toInteger(split_ordinal[1])
CALL
  apoc.case(
    [
      variable_root.uid = "STUDYID",
      'MATCH (n:StudyRoot {uid:$neodash_studyroot_uid})-[:LATEST]->(s:StudyValue) RETURN s.study_id_prefix + "-" + s.study_number AS examples',
      variable_root.uid = "VISIT",
      'MATCH p=(n:StudyRoot {uid:$neodash_studyroot_uid})-[:LATEST]->(s:StudyValue)-->(visit:StudyVisit)-->(:StudyActivitySchedule)<--(:StudyActivity)-->(:StudyActivitySubGroup)-->(asgv:ActivitySubGroupValue)-->(:ActivityValidGroup)-->(:ActivityGroupValue{name: "Laboratory Assessments"}) WHERE asgv.name <> "Antibodies" and asgv.name <> "PK Sampling" WITH DISTINCT visit.short_visit_label AS visit_label, visit.visit_number AS visit_number ORDER BY visit_number RETURN collect(visit_label) AS examples',
      variable_root.uid = "LBMETHOD",
      'MATCH (:StudyRoot {uid: $neodash_studyroot_uid})-[:LATEST]->(s:StudyValue)-[:HAS_STUDY_VISIT]->(visit:StudyVisit)-[:STUDY_VISIT_HAS_SCHEDULE]->(:StudyActivitySchedule)<-[:STUDY_ACTIVITY_HAS_SCHEDULE]-(s_act:StudyActivity)-[:STUDY_ACTIVITY_HAS_STUDY_ACTIVITY_SUBGROUP]->(:StudyActivitySubGroup)-[:HAS_SELECTED_ACTIVITY_SUBGROUP]->(asgv:ActivitySubGroupValue)-[:HAS_GROUP]->(sg:ActivityValidGroup)-[:IN_GROUP]->(:ActivityGroupValue {name: "Laboratory Assessments"}) WHERE asgv.name <> "Antibodies" AND asgv.name <> "PK Sampling" WITH DISTINCT s, visit, s_act MATCH(s_act)-[:HAS_SELECTED_ACTIVITY]->(p_act:ActivityValue)-[:HAS_GROUPING]->(g:ActivityGrouping)<-[:HAS_ACTIVITY]-(p_ai:ActivityInstanceValue)<-[r1:HAS_SELECTED_ACTIVITY_INSTANCE]-(s_ai:StudyActivityInstance)<-[r2:HAS_STUDY_ACTIVITY_INSTANCE]-(sv:StudyValue)-[r3:HAS_STUDY_VISIT]->(visit:StudyVisit) WITH DISTINCT s, visit, p_act, p_ai MATCH(p_ai)-[r4:CONTAINS_ACTIVITY_ITEM]->(p_aitm2:ActivityItem)<--(:ActivityItemClassRoot)-[:LATEST]->(:ActivityItemClassValue {name:"method"}) WITH DISTINCT p_aitm2 OPTIONAL MATCH(p_aitm2)-[r4:HAS_CT_TERM]->(ct_context:CTTermContext)-[r5_1:HAS_SELECTED_TERM]->(n6:CTTermRoot)-[r6:HAS_ATTRIBUTES_ROOT]->(n7:CTTermAttributesRoot)-[r7:HAS_VERSION]->(n8:CTTermAttributesValue) OPTIONAL MATCH(n6)<-[:HAS_TERM_ROOT]-(subm_val:CTCodelistTerm) RETURN collect(distinct subm_val.submission_value) AS examples'
    ],
    'RETURN "" AS examples',
    {neodash_studyroot_uid: $neodash_studyroot_uid}
  )
  YIELD value
WITH
  variable_root,
  variable_value,
  var_class_inst,
  var_class,
  sponModVarClasInst,
  split_ordinal,
  value,
  CASE
    WHEN variable_root.uid = 'LBNAM' THEN COALESCE(
  NULLIF($neodash_lab_supplier_name, ""),
  NULLIF($neodash_lab_supplier___manual, ""))
    ELSE value.examples
  END AS Examples
RETURN DISTINCT
  split_ordinal AS Position,
  variable_root.uid AS `Column Header`,
  variable_value.simple_datatype AS `Data type`,
  variable_value.length AS `Max Length`,
  variable_value.label AS `Content Description`,
  sponModVarClasInst.core AS Mandatory,
  Examples

reports.title: Study selected
reports.query:
MATCH (n0:StudyRoot {uid:$neodash_studyroot_uid})-[r1:LATEST]->(n1:StudyValue)
WITH CASE WHEN (n1.study_number is not null and n1.study_acronym is not null) THEN (n1.study_id_prefix + '-'+n1.study_number+ " [" + n1.study_acronym + "]") ELSE CASE WHEN n1.study_acronym is null THEN (n1.study_id_prefix + '-'+n1.study_number) ELSE (n1.study_id_prefix + " [" + n1.study_acronym + "]") END END AS Value
RETURN DISTINCT Value

reports.title: Spec Version selected
reports.query: return $neodash_lab_specification_version

reports.title: Expected data content for laboratory findings
reports.query:
The table below should be used as a tool to identify the topic codes and codelist values that should be in the LAB data file from the supplier. 

  - CDP-DMW: Fill in the grey column based on the protocol. [If you are in doubt about which assessments are relevant for the supplier, please reach out to the CTDM in the study.]

  - CDP-DMW and supplier collaboration: Fill in the blue columns based on information from the supplier's system.

  - CDP-DMW and SDTM Programmer collaboration: Using the information from the supplier in the blue columns, fill in the green columns, which should reflect the expected content of the data file. For example, the green 'UNITCOLL' column should be populated with the codelist-compliant synonym of the blue 'Supplier unit'.

  - Supplier: Use the information in the green columns when creating the data file.

[It is important to consider data type (e.g. numeric or categoric), specimen and unit when selecting the topic code. 
UNITCOLL in the table below should be populated with a unit that is synonymous with the supplier unit, meaning that the supplier will not do result conversion. Note that the UNITCOLL unit does not have to be the standard unit of the topic code, as long as it is possible to do a conversion from UNITCOLL unit to standard unit in the SDTM Generation Framework. This requires that the standard unit of the topic code is either in the same unit dimension as the UNITCOLL unit or a complex conversion should be available in GCMD for the two units.

When populating codelist-controlled columns, look up CDISC or sponsor-defined submission values in StandVIEW. 
Consult the Implementation Group Standards Developer for the study if in doubt about topic codes or codelist values.

The green columns marked with red header text can be deleted if the supplier is not expected to deliver that information, but the empty columns should still be present in the data file.

If it is impossible for the supplier to provide TOPICCD, the supplier should provide other information, e.g. SUPTEST and study-specific data file columns, so that TOPICCD can be derived with an expression in DMW.
The assessment examples shown in red text below do not necessarily represent actual data in a study.]

reports.title: LAB Content
reports.query:
MATCH
  (:StudyRoot {uid: $neodash_studyroot_uid})-[:LATEST]->
  (s:StudyValue)-[:HAS_STUDY_VISIT]->
  (visit:StudyVisit)-[:STUDY_VISIT_HAS_SCHEDULE]->
  (:StudyActivitySchedule)<-[:STUDY_ACTIVITY_HAS_SCHEDULE]-
  (s_act:StudyActivity)-[:STUDY_ACTIVITY_HAS_STUDY_ACTIVITY_SUBGROUP]->
  (:StudyActivitySubGroup)-[:HAS_SELECTED_ACTIVITY_SUBGROUP]->
  (asgv:ActivitySubGroupValue)-[:HAS_GROUP]->
  (sg:ActivityValidGroup)-[:IN_GROUP]->
  (:ActivityGroupValue {name: "Laboratory Assessments"}),(s_act)-[:HAS_SELECTED_ACTIVITY]->
  (p_act:ActivityValue)
WHERE asgv.name <> "Antibodies" AND asgv.name <> "PK Sampling"  AND asgv.name <> "Pharmacodynamics"
WITH DISTINCT s, visit, s_act,p_act
MATCH
  (s_act)-[:HAS_SELECTED_ACTIVITY]->
  (p_act:ActivityValue)-[:HAS_GROUPING]->
  (g:ActivityGrouping)<-[:HAS_ACTIVITY]-
  (p_ai:ActivityInstanceValue)<-[:HAS_SELECTED_ACTIVITY_INSTANCE]-
  (:StudyActivityInstance)<-[:HAS_STUDY_ACTIVITY_INSTANCE]-
  (:StudyValue)-[:HAS_STUDY_VISIT]->
  (visit:StudyVisit)
WITH DISTINCT s, visit, p_act, p_ai
CALL {
  WITH s, visit, p_act, p_ai
  OPTIONAL MATCH (p_ai)-[:CONTAINS_ACTIVITY_ITEM]->(p_aitm1:ActivityItem)
  WITH DISTINCT p_aitm1
  OPTIONAL MATCH
    (p_aitm1)-[:HAS_UNIT_DEFINITION]->
    (:UnitDefinitionRoot)-[:LATEST]->
    (p_unitdef:UnitDefinitionValue)
  RETURN collect(DISTINCT p_unitdef.name) AS unitcoll
}
CALL {
  WITH s, visit, p_act, p_ai
  OPTIONAL MATCH
    (p_ai)-[:CONTAINS_ACTIVITY_ITEM]->
    (p_aitm1:ActivityItem)<--
    (:ActivityItemClassRoot)-[:LATEST]->
    (:ActivityItemClassValue {name: "specimen"})
  WITH DISTINCT p_aitm1
  OPTIONAL MATCH
  (p_aitm1)-[:HAS_CT_TERM]->
  (:CTTermContext)-[:HAS_SELECTED_TERM]->
  (:CTTermRoot)<-[:HAS_TERM_ROOT]-(subm_val1:CTCodelistTerm)
  RETURN subm_val1.submission_value AS lbspec
}
CALL {
  WITH s, visit, p_act, p_ai
  OPTIONAL MATCH
    (p_ai)-[:CONTAINS_ACTIVITY_ITEM]->
    (p_aitm2:ActivityItem)<--
    (:ActivityItemClassRoot)-[:LATEST]->
    (:ActivityItemClassValue {name: "method"})
  WITH DISTINCT p_aitm2
  OPTIONAL MATCH
    (p_aitm2)-[:HAS_CT_TERM]->
    (:CTTermContext)-[:HAS_SELECTED_TERM]->
    (:CTTermRoot)<-[:HAS_TERM_ROOT]-(subm_val2:CTCodelistTerm)
  RETURN subm_val2.submission_value AS lbmethod
}
CALL {
  WITH s, visit, p_act, p_ai
  OPTIONAL MATCH
    (p_ai)-[:CONTAINS_ACTIVITY_ITEM]->
    (p_aitm3:ActivityItem)<--
    (:ActivityItemClassRoot)-[:LATEST]->
    (:ActivityItemClassValue {name: "original_result"})
  WITH DISTINCT p_aitm3
  OPTIONAL MATCH
    (p_aitm3)-[:HAS_CT_TERM]->
    (:CTTermContext)-[:HAS_SELECTED_TERM]->
    (:CTTermRoot)<-[:HAS_TERM_ROOT]-(subm_val3:CTCodelistTerm)
  RETURN collect(DISTINCT subm_val3.submission_value) AS lbstresc
}
WITH
  p_act,
  unitcoll,
  lbstresc,
  p_ai,
  CASE
    WHEN size(lbmethod) > 0 THEN lbmethod
    ELSE 'To be provided'
  END AS lbmethod,
  CASE
    WHEN size(lbspec) > 0 THEN lbspec
    ELSE 'To be provided'
  END AS lbspec
  RETURN DISTINCT p_act.name AS `Assessment description based on protocol`,
  'To be provided' AS `Supplier Assessment`,
  'To be provided' AS `Supplier Unit`,
  'To be provided' AS `Supplier Method Name`,
  unitcoll AS UNITCOLL,
  lbspec AS LBSPEC,
  p_ai.topic_code AS TOPICCD,
  lbstresc AS `Valid LBSTRESC values for categorical results`,
  lbmethod AS LBMETHOD,
  CASE 
    WHEN $neodash_lab_specification_version = 'Lab Spec IG v0.1(v8.0)' THEN 'To be completed'
  END AS  LBSPCCND,
  'To be completed' AS LBANMETH,
CASE 
    WHEN $neodash_lab_specification_version = 'Lab Spec IG v0.1(v8.0)' THEN p_ai.adam_param_code
    END AS ADaMCD

styleRules.field: Valid LBSTRESC values for categorical results

reports.title: Study selected
reports.query:
MATCH (n0:StudyRoot {uid:$neodash_studyroot_uid})-[r1:LATEST]->(n1:StudyValue)
WITH CASE WHEN (n1.study_number is not null and n1.study_acronym is not null) THEN (n1.study_id_prefix + '-'+n1.study_number+ " [" + n1.study_acronym + "]") ELSE CASE WHEN n1.study_acronym is null THEN (n1.study_id_prefix + '-'+n1.study_number) ELSE (n1.study_id_prefix + " [" + n1.study_acronym + "]") END END AS Value
RETURN DISTINCT Value

reports.title: Spec Version selected
reports.query: return $neodash_lab_specification_version

reports.title: Data file specification for reference ranges
reports.query:
Data file specification for reference ranges

LABRANGE data description: Reference ranges for assessments in LAB data file that are required for analyses in Biostatistics. 

[A LABRANGE file should only be requested from the supplier in rare cases where reference range information in LAB data and COSMOS is not sufficient for Biostatistics needs. It is an ILProg decision whether a LABRANGE file should be requested, so please get input from the ILProg during preparation of the data specification.
Note that the data is not imported into DMW. The LABRANGE file is automatically transferred to the statistical computing environment. The Trial Programmer on the study will need to implement a program to process it (with assistance from the ADaM template maintenance group).]

- All columns listed in the table below should be present in the data file and their order should not be changed. 

- The data file header line with the pipe-delimited column headers is shown for your reference below.

- The instructions in 'Mandatory/optional' specify if it is mandatory to populate a column. 

- The first LABRANGE data file should be provided at the time of first production load of the LAB.txt file. An updated LABRANGE data file should be provided in case of any changes in reference ranges. A test file is not required.

- The data types specified in the table below are the Oracle database data types that the data can be loaded into. VARCHAR2 stores alphanumeric strings. The maximum length is specified for each column. Data type NUMBER stores numeric data."					

Data file header line:					

STUDYID|LBNAM|TOPICCD|SEX|STARTDATE|ENDDATE|AGEMIN|AGEMINU|AGEMAX|AGEMAXU|RANGEMIN|RANGEMAX|UNIT

reports.title: LAB Range
reports.query:
MATCH
  (model_root:DataModelIGRoot)-->
  (model_value:DataModelIGValue)-[:HAS_DATASET]->
  (dataset_value:DatasetInstance)<--
  (:Dataset{uid:"LABRANGE"})
WHERE
  toLower(
    apoc.text.join(
      [model_value.name, '(v', model_value.version_number, ')'],
      ""
    )) =
  toLower($neodash_lab_specification_version)
MATCH
  (dataset_value)-[rel:HAS_DATASET_VARIABLE]->
  (variable_value:DatasetVariableInstance)<--
  (variable_root:DatasetVariable)
WHERE rel.version_number = model_value.version_number
OPTIONAL MATCH
  (variable_value)-->
  (var_class_inst:VariableClassInstance)<--
  (var_class:VariableClass)-->
  (sponModVarClasInst:SponsorModelVariableClassInstance)
WITH
  variable_root,
  variable_value,
  var_class_inst,
  var_class,
  sponModVarClasInst,
  apoc.text.split(rel.ordinal, "\.") AS split_ordinal
ORDER BY toInteger(split_ordinal[0]), toInteger(split_ordinal[1])
CALL
  apoc.case(
    [
      variable_root.uid = "STUDYID",
      'MATCH (n:StudyRoot {uid:$neodash_studyroot_uid})-[:LATEST]->(s:StudyValue) RETURN s.study_id_prefix + "-" + s.study_number AS examples',
      variable_root.uid = "VISIT",
      'MATCH p=(n:StudyRoot {uid:$neodash_studyroot_uid})-[:LATEST]->(s:StudyValue)-->(visit:StudyVisit)-->(:StudyActivitySchedule)<--(:StudyActivity)-->(:StudyActivitySubGroup)-->(:ActivitySubGroupValue)-->(:ActivityValidGroup)-->(:ActivityGroupValue{name: "Laboratory Assessments"}) WITH DISTINCT visit.short_visit_label AS visit_label, visit.visit_number AS visit_number ORDER BY visit_number RETURN collect(visit_label) AS examples'
    ],
    'RETURN "" AS examples',
    {neodash_studyroot_uid: $neodash_studyroot_uid}
  )
  YIELD value
WITH
  variable_root,
  variable_value,
  var_class_inst,
  var_class,
  sponModVarClasInst,
  split_ordinal,
  value,
  CASE
    WHEN variable_root.uid = 'LBNAM' THEN $neodash_lab_supplier_name
    ELSE value.examples
  END AS Examples
RETURN DISTINCT
  split_ordinal AS Position,
  variable_root.uid AS `Column Header`,
  variable_value.simple_datatype AS `Data type`,
  variable_value.length AS `Max Length`,
  variable_value.label AS `Content Description`,
  sponModVarClasInst.core AS Mandatory,
  Examples

reports.title: Study selected
reports.query:
MATCH (n0:StudyRoot {uid:$neodash_studyroot_uid})-[r1:LATEST]->(n1:StudyValue)
WITH CASE WHEN (n1.study_number is not null and n1.study_acronym is not null) THEN (n1.study_id_prefix + '-'+n1.study_number+ " [" + n1.study_acronym + "]") ELSE CASE WHEN n1.study_acronym is null THEN (n1.study_id_prefix + '-'+n1.study_number) ELSE (n1.study_id_prefix + " [" + n1.study_acronym + "]") END END AS Value
RETURN DISTINCT Value

reports.title: Spec Version selected
reports.query: return $neodash_lab_specification_version

reports.title: Data file specification for pharmacokinetics
reports.query:
PK data description: Concentrations of drugs or metabolites in fluids or tissues as a function of time.

• All columns listed in the table below should be present in the data file and their order should not be changed. 

• For columns that are not applicable, the column header should remain, and the content in the column should be set to NULL (i.e. left blank) in each record in the file. 

• The data file header line with the pipe-delimited column headers is shown for your reference below.

• The instructions in 'Mandatory/optional' specify if it is mandatory to populate a column. [Exceptions from this can, in rare cases, be agreed with the supplier while preparing the data specification.]
[Addition of study-specific data file columns to the specification should be discussed in an Implementation Group meeting. If additional data file columns are required, e.g. QNAMs, please add the additional columns as new rows at the end of this table and ensure to add the extra columns to the relevant tables in DMW for the study. If an added column should  be compliant with a codelist, please add the data file column to the content sheet so that relevant codelist submission values can be communicated to the supplier.]

• For codelist-controlled columns, supplier values should be mapped to the corresponding CDISC codelist values or to Novo Nordisk-defined additions to the codelists that are extensible. See the relevant codelist values as well as study-specific file content in the 'PK, content' sheet. 

• The data types specified in the table below are the Oracle database data types that the data will be loaded into. VARCHAR2 stores alphanumeric strings. The maximum length is specified for each column. Data type NUMBER stores numeric data.

Data file header line:

STUDYID|DOMAIN|SITE|SUBJID|FSUBJID|VISIT|PCREFID|TOPICCD|SUPTEST|PCORRES|UNITCOLL|LLOQ|ULOQ|PCSTAT|PCREASND |PCNAM|PCSPEC|PCSPCCND|PCMETHOD |PCDTC|PCTPT|SUBEVNUM|COMMENTALL

reports.title: $neodash_lab_spec_dataset, Structure
reports.query:
MATCH
  (model_root:DataModelIGRoot)-->
  (model_value:DataModelIGValue)-[:HAS_DATASET]->
  (dataset_value:DatasetInstance)<--
  (:Dataset{uid:$neodash_lab_spec_dataset})
WHERE
  toLower(
    apoc.text.join(
      [model_value.name, '(v', model_value.version_number, ')'],
      ""
    )) =
  toLower($neodash_lab_specification_version)
MATCH
  (dataset_value)-[rel:HAS_DATASET_VARIABLE]->
  (variable_value:DatasetVariableInstance)<--
  (variable_root:DatasetVariable)
WHERE rel.version_number = model_value.version_number
OPTIONAL MATCH
  (variable_value)-->
  (var_class_inst:VariableClassInstance)<--
  (var_class:VariableClass)-->
  (sponModVarClasInst:SponsorModelVariableClassInstance)
WITH
  variable_root,
  variable_value,
  var_class_inst,
  var_class,
  sponModVarClasInst,
  apoc.text.split(rel.ordinal, "\.") AS split_ordinal
ORDER BY toInteger(split_ordinal[0]), toInteger(split_ordinal[1])
CALL
  apoc.case(
    [
      variable_root.uid = "STUDYID",
      'MATCH (n:StudyRoot {uid:$neodash_studyroot_uid})-[:LATEST]->(s:StudyValue) RETURN s.study_id_prefix + "-" + s.study_number AS examples',
      variable_root.uid = "VISIT",
      'MATCH p=(n:StudyRoot {uid:$neodash_studyroot_uid})-[:LATEST]->(s:StudyValue)-->(visit:StudyVisit)-->(:StudyActivitySchedule)<--(:StudyActivity)-->(:StudyActivitySubGroup)-->(:ActivitySubGroupValue{name: "PK Sampling"})-->(:ActivityValidGroup)-->(:ActivityGroupValue) WITH DISTINCT visit.short_visit_label AS visit_label, visit.visit_number AS visit_number ORDER BY visit_number RETURN collect(visit_label) AS examples'
    ],
    'RETURN "" AS examples',
    {neodash_studyroot_uid: $neodash_studyroot_uid}
  )
  YIELD value
WITH
  variable_root,
  variable_value,
  var_class_inst,
  var_class,
  sponModVarClasInst,
  split_ordinal,
  value,
  CASE
    WHEN variable_root.uid = 'PCNAM' THEN COALESCE(
  NULLIF($neodash_pk_supplier_name, ""),
  NULLIF($neodash_pk_supplier___manual, ""))
    ELSE value.examples
  END AS Examples
RETURN DISTINCT
  split_ordinal AS Position,
  variable_root.uid AS `Column Header`,
  variable_value.simple_datatype AS `Data type`,
  variable_value.length AS `Max Length`,
  variable_value.label AS `Content Description`,
  sponModVarClasInst.core AS Mandatory,
  Examples

reports.title: Spec Version selected
reports.query: return $neodash_lab_specification_version

reports.title: Study selected
reports.query:
MATCH (n0:StudyRoot {uid:$neodash_studyroot_uid})-[r1:LATEST]->(n1:StudyValue)
WITH CASE WHEN (n1.study_number is not null and n1.study_acronym is not null) THEN (n1.study_id_prefix + '-'+n1.study_number+ " [" + n1.study_acronym + "]") ELSE CASE WHEN n1.study_acronym is null THEN (n1.study_id_prefix + '-'+n1.study_number) ELSE (n1.study_id_prefix + " [" + n1.study_acronym + "]") END END AS Value
RETURN DISTINCT Value

reports.title: PK/PD spec dataset
reports.query:
MATCH
  (model_root:DataModelIGRoot)-->
  (model_value:DataModelIGValue)-[:HAS_DATASET]->
  (dataset_value:DatasetInstance)<--
  (ds:Dataset)
WHERE
  toLower(
    apoc.text.join(
      [model_value.name, '(v', model_value.version_number, ')'],
      ""
    )) =
  toLower($neodash_lab_specification_version)
WITH ds WHERE NOT ds.uid IN ['LB','LABRANGE','AB','LAB'] 
WITH ds WHERE
toLower(toString(ds.`uid`)) CONTAINS toLower($input) 
RETURN DISTINCT ds.`uid` as value,  ds.`uid` as display ORDER BY size(toString(value)) ASC LIMIT 100

reports.title: Expected data content for pharmacokinetics
reports.query:
The table below should be used as a tool to identify the topic codes and codelist values that should be in the PK data file from the supplier. 

  - CDP-DMW: Fill in the grey column based on the protocol. [If you are in doubt about which assessments are relevant for the supplier, please reach out to the CTDM in the study.]

  - CDP-DMW and supplier collaboration: Fill in the blue columns based on information from the supplier's system.

  - CDP-DMW and SDTM Programmer collaboration: Using the information from the supplier in the blue columns, fill in the green columns, which should reflect the expected content of the data file. For example, the green 'UNITCOLL' column should be populated with the codelist-compliant synonym of the blue 'Supplier unit'.

  - Supplier: Use the information in the green columns when creating the data file.

[It is important to consider data type (e.g. numeric or categoric), specimen and unit when selecting the topic code. 

UNITCOLL in the table below should be populated with a unit that is synonymous with the supplier unit, meaning that the supplier will not do result conversion. Note that the UNITCOLL unit does not have to be the standard unit of the topic code, as long as it is possible to do a conversion from UNITCOLL unit to standard unit in the SDTM Generation Framework. This requires that the standard unit of the topic code is either in the same unit dimension as the UNITCOLL unit or a complex conversion should be available in GCMD for the two units.

When populating codelist-controlled columns, look up CDISC or sponsor-defined submission values in StandVIEW. 

Consult the Implementation Group Standards Developer for the study if in doubt about topic codes or codelist values.

The green columns marked with red header text can be deleted if the supplier is not expected to deliver that information, but the empty columns should still be present in the data file.

If it is impossible for the supplier to provide TOPICCD, the supplier should provide other information, e.g. SUPTEST and study-specific data file columns, so that TOPICCD can be derived with an expression in DMW.

The assessment examples shown in red text below do not necessarily represent actual data in a study.]

reports.title: PK Content
reports.query:
MATCH
  (:StudyRoot {uid: $neodash_studyroot_uid})-[:LATEST]->
  (s:StudyValue)-[:HAS_STUDY_VISIT]->
  (visit:StudyVisit)-[:STUDY_VISIT_HAS_SCHEDULE]->
  (:StudyActivitySchedule)<-[:STUDY_ACTIVITY_HAS_SCHEDULE]-
  (s_act:StudyActivity)-[:STUDY_ACTIVITY_HAS_STUDY_ACTIVITY_SUBGROUP]->
  (:StudyActivitySubGroup)-[:HAS_SELECTED_ACTIVITY_SUBGROUP]->
  (asgv:ActivitySubGroupValue)-[:HAS_GROUP]->
  (sg:ActivityValidGroup)-[:IN_GROUP]->
  (agv:ActivityGroupValue),(s_act)-[:HAS_SELECTED_ACTIVITY]->
  (p_act:ActivityValue) 
  WITH DISTINCT s, visit, s_act,p_act, CASE when toLower(agv.name) in ['pk sampling','pk parameter'] THEN 'PK' ELSE CASE WHEN toLower(agv.name) in ['pd sampling'] OR (toLower(agv.name)='laboratory assessments' AND toLower(asgv.name)='pharmacodynamics') THEN 'PD' END END AS PharmacologyType
WITH DISTINCT s, visit, s_act,p_act,PharmacologyType  where PharmacologyType=$neodash_pharmacology_type
MATCH
  (s_act)-[:HAS_SELECTED_ACTIVITY]->
  (p_act:ActivityValue)-[:HAS_GROUPING]->
  (g:ActivityGrouping)<-[:HAS_ACTIVITY]-
  (p_ai:ActivityInstanceValue)<-[:HAS_SELECTED_ACTIVITY_INSTANCE]-
  (:StudyActivityInstance)<-[:HAS_STUDY_ACTIVITY_INSTANCE]-
  (:StudyValue)-[:HAS_STUDY_VISIT]->
  (visit:StudyVisit)
WITH DISTINCT s, visit, p_act, p_ai
CALL {
  WITH s, visit, p_act, p_ai
  OPTIONAL MATCH (p_ai)-[:CONTAINS_ACTIVITY_ITEM]->(p_aitm1:ActivityItem)
  WITH DISTINCT p_aitm1
  OPTIONAL MATCH
    (p_aitm1)-[:HAS_UNIT_DEFINITION]->
    (:UnitDefinitionRoot)-[:LATEST]->
    (p_unitdef:UnitDefinitionValue)
  RETURN collect(DISTINCT p_unitdef.name) AS unitcoll
}
CALL {
  WITH s, visit, p_act, p_ai
  OPTIONAL MATCH
    (p_ai)-[:CONTAINS_ACTIVITY_ITEM]->
    (p_aitm1:ActivityItem)<--
    (:ActivityItemClassRoot)-[:LATEST]->
    (:ActivityItemClassValue {name: "specimen"})
  WITH DISTINCT p_aitm1
  OPTIONAL MATCH
  (p_aitm1)-[:HAS_CT_TERM]->
  (:CTTermContext)-[:HAS_SELECTED_TERM]->
  (:CTTermRoot)<-[:HAS_TERM_ROOT]-(subm_val1:CTCodelistTerm)
  RETURN subm_val1.submission_value AS lbspec
}
CALL {
  WITH s, visit, p_act, p_ai
  OPTIONAL MATCH
    (p_ai)-[:CONTAINS_ACTIVITY_ITEM]->
    (p_aitm2:ActivityItem)<--
    (:ActivityItemClassRoot)-[:LATEST]->
    (:ActivityItemClassValue {name: "method"})
  WITH DISTINCT p_aitm2
  OPTIONAL MATCH
    (p_aitm2)-[:HAS_CT_TERM]->
    (:CTTermContext)-[:HAS_SELECTED_TERM]->
    (:CTTermRoot)<-[:HAS_TERM_ROOT]-(subm_val2:CTCodelistTerm)
  RETURN subm_val2.submission_value AS lbmethod
}
CALL {
  WITH s, visit, p_act, p_ai
  OPTIONAL MATCH
    (p_ai)-[:CONTAINS_ACTIVITY_ITEM]->
    (p_aitm3:ActivityItem)<--
    (:ActivityItemClassRoot)-[:LATEST]->
    (:ActivityItemClassValue {name: "original_result"})
  WITH DISTINCT p_aitm3
  OPTIONAL MATCH
    (p_aitm3)-[:HAS_CT_TERM]->
    (:CTTermContext)-[:HAS_SELECTED_TERM]->
    (:CTTermRoot)<-[:HAS_TERM_ROOT]-(subm_val3:CTCodelistTerm)
  RETURN collect(DISTINCT subm_val3.submission_value) AS lbstresc
}
WITH
  p_act,
  unitcoll,
  lbstresc,
  p_ai,
  CASE
    WHEN size(lbmethod) > 0 THEN lbmethod
    ELSE 'To be provided'
  END AS lbmethod,
  CASE
    WHEN size(lbspec) > 0 THEN lbspec
    ELSE 'To be provided'
  END AS lbspec
  RETURN DISTINCT p_act.name AS `Assessment description based on protocol`,
  'To be provided' AS `Supplier Assessment`,
  'To be provided' AS `Supplier Unit`,
  'To be provided' AS `Supplier Method Name`,
  unitcoll AS UNITCOLL,
  lbspec AS PCSPEC,
  p_ai.topic_code AS TOPICCD,
  lbmethod AS PCMETHOD

reports.title: Study selected
reports.query:
MATCH (n0:StudyRoot {uid:$neodash_studyroot_uid})-[r1:LATEST]->(n1:StudyValue)
WITH CASE WHEN (n1.study_number is not null and n1.study_acronym is not null) THEN (n1.study_id_prefix + '-'+n1.study_number+ " [" + n1.study_acronym + "]") ELSE CASE WHEN n1.study_acronym is null THEN (n1.study_id_prefix + '-'+n1.study_number) ELSE (n1.study_id_prefix + " [" + n1.study_acronym + "]") END END AS Value
RETURN DISTINCT Value

reports.title: Pharmacology Type
reports.query:
MATCH
  (:StudyRoot {uid: $neodash_studyroot_uid})-[:LATEST]->
  (s:StudyValue)-[:HAS_STUDY_VISIT]->
  (visit:StudyVisit)-[:STUDY_VISIT_HAS_SCHEDULE]->
  (:StudyActivitySchedule)<-[:STUDY_ACTIVITY_HAS_SCHEDULE]-
  (s_act:StudyActivity)-[:STUDY_ACTIVITY_HAS_STUDY_ACTIVITY_SUBGROUP]->
  (:StudyActivitySubGroup)-[:HAS_SELECTED_ACTIVITY_SUBGROUP]->
  (asgv:ActivitySubGroupValue)-[:HAS_GROUP]->
  (sg:ActivityValidGroup)-[:IN_GROUP]->
  (agv:ActivityGroupValue),(s_act)-[:HAS_SELECTED_ACTIVITY]->
  (p_act:ActivityValue) 
  WITH DISTINCT agv, asgv, CASE when toLower(agv.name) in ['pk sampling','pk parameter'] THEN 'PK' ELSE CASE WHEN toLower(agv.name) in ['pd sampling'] OR (toLower(agv.name)='laboratory assessments' AND toLower(asgv.name)='pharmacodynamics') THEN 'PD' END END AS `Pharmacology Type`
WITH `Pharmacology Type` where `Pharmacology Type` is not null
return DISTINCT `Pharmacology Type` order by `Pharmacology Type` DESC

reports.title: Data file specification for antibody findings
reports.query:
AB data description: Assessments of antibody presence or antibody titre.

• All columns listed in the table below should be present in the data file and their order should not be changed. 

• For columns that are not applicable, the column header should remain, and the content in the column should be set to NULL (i.e. left blank) in each record in the file. 

• The data file header line with the pipe-delimited column headers is shown for your reference below.

• The instructions in 'Mandatory/optional' specify if it is mandatory to populate a column. [Exceptions from this can, in rare cases, be agreed with the supplier while preparing the data specification.]
[Addition of study-specific data file columns to the specification should be discussed in an Implementation Group meeting. If additional data file columns are required, e.g. QNAMs, please add the additional columns as new rows at the end of this table and ensure to add the extra columns to the relevant tables in DMW for the study. If an added column should  be compliant with a codelist, please add the data file column to the content sheet so that relevant codelist submission values can be communicated to the supplier.]

• For codelist-controlled columns, supplier values should be mapped to the corresponding CDISC codelist values or to Novo Nordisk-defined additions to the codelists that are extensible. See the relevant codelist values as well as study-specific file content in the 'AB, content' sheet. 

• The data types specified in the table below are the Oracle database data types that the data will be loaded into. VARCHAR2 stores alphanumeric strings. The maximum length is specified for each column. Data type NUMBER stores numeric data.

Data file header line:

STUDYID|DOMAIN|SITE|SUBJID|FSUBJID|VISIT|LBREFID|TOPICCD|SUPTEST|LBORRES|UNITCOLL|LBSTAT|LBREASND|LBNAM|LBSPEC|LBSPCCND|LBDTC|SUBEVNUM|COMMENTALL

MATCH (model_root:DataModelIGRoot)-->(model_value:DataModelIGValue)
-[:HAS_DATASET]->(dataset_value:DatasetInstance)<--(:Dataset {uid: "AB"}) WHERE toLower(apoc.text.join([model_value.name,'(v',model_value.version_number,')'],""))=toLower($neodash_lab_specification_version)
MATCH (dataset_value)-[rel:HAS_DATASET_VARIABLE]->(variable_value:DatasetVariableInstance)<--(variable_root:DatasetVariable)
WHERE rel.version_number=model_value.version_number
OPTIONAL MATCH (variable_value)-->(var_class_inst:VariableClassInstance)<--(var_class:VariableClass)-->(sponModVarClasInst:SponsorModelVariableClassInstance)
WITH variable_root, variable_value, var_class_inst, var_class, sponModVarClasInst, apoc.text.split(rel.ordinal, "\.") AS split_ordinal ORDER BY toInteger(split_ordinal[0]), toInteger(split_ordinal[1])
CALL apoc.case([
    variable_root.uid = "STUDYID", 'MATCH (n:StudyRoot {uid:$neodash_studyroot_uid})-[:LATEST]->(s:StudyValue) RETURN s.study_id_prefix + "-" + s.study_number AS examples',
    variable_root.uid = "VISIT", 'MATCH p=(n:StudyRoot {uid:$neodash_studyroot_uid})-[:LATEST]->(s:StudyValue)-->(visit:StudyVisit)-->(:StudyActivitySchedule)<--(:StudyActivity)-->(:StudyActivitySubGroup)-->(:ActivitySubGroupValue{name: "Antibodies"})-->(:ActivityValidGroup)-->(:ActivityGroupValue{name: "Laboratory Assessments"}) WITH DISTINCT visit.short_visit_label AS visit_label, visit.visit_number AS visit_number ORDER BY visit_number RETURN collect(visit_label) AS examples'
], 'RETURN "" AS examples', {neodash_studyroot_uid:$neodash_studyroot_uid})
YIELD value
WITH variable_root, variable_value, var_class_inst, var_class, sponModVarClasInst, split_ordinal, value, CASE WHEN variable_root.uid = 'ABNAM' THEN COALESCE(
  NULLIF($neodash_ab_supplier_name, ""),
  NULLIF($neodash_ab_supplier___manual, "")) ELSE value.examples END AS Examples
RETURN DISTINCT split_ordinal AS Position, variable_root.uid AS `Column Header`, variable_value.simple_datatype AS `Data type`, variable_value.length AS `Max Length`, variable_value.label AS `Content Description`, sponModVarClasInst.core AS Mandatory, Examples

reports.title: Study selected
reports.query:
MATCH (n0:StudyRoot {uid:$neodash_studyroot_uid})-[r1:LATEST]->(n1:StudyValue)
WITH CASE WHEN (n1.study_number is not null and n1.study_acronym is not null) THEN (n1.study_id_prefix + '-'+n1.study_number+ " [" + n1.study_acronym + "]") ELSE CASE WHEN n1.study_acronym is null THEN (n1.study_id_prefix + '-'+n1.study_number) ELSE (n1.study_id_prefix + " [" + n1.study_acronym + "]") END END AS Value
RETURN DISTINCT Value

reports.title: Data file specification for antibody findings
reports.query:
AB data description: Assessments of antibody presence or antibody titre.

• All columns listed in the table below should be present in the data file and their order should not be changed.

• For columns that are not applicable, the column header should remain, and the content in the column should be set to NULL (i.e. left blank) in each record in the file. 

• The data file header line with the pipe-delimited column headers is shown for your reference below.

• The instructions in 'Mandatory/optional' specify if it is mandatory to populate a column. [Exceptions from this can, in rare cases, be agreed with the supplier while preparing the data specification.]
[Addition of study-specific data file columns to the specification should be discussed in an Implementation Group meeting. If additional data file columns are required, e.g. QNAMs, please add the additional columns as new rows at the end of this table and ensure to add the extra columns to the relevant tables in DMW for the study. If an added column should  be compliant with a codelist, please add the data file column to the content sheet so that relevant codelist submission values can be communicated to the supplier.]

• For codelist-controlled columns, supplier values should be mapped to the corresponding CDISC codelist values or to Novo Nordisk-defined additions to the codelists that are extensible. See the relevant codelist values as well as study-specific file content in the 'AB, content' sheet. 

• The data types specified in the table below are the Oracle database data types that the data will be loaded into. VARCHAR2 stores alphanumeric strings. The maximum length is specified for each column. Data type NUMBER stores numeric data.

**Data file header line:**

STUDYID|DOMAIN|SITE|SUBJID|FSUBJID|VISIT|LBREFID|TOPICCD|SUPTEST|LBORRES|UNITCOLL|LBSTAT|LBREASND|LBNAM|LBSPEC|LBSPCCND|LBDTC|SUBEVNUM|COMMENTALL

reports.title: AB Content
reports.query:
MATCH
  (:StudyRoot {uid: $neodash_studyroot_uid})-[:LATEST]->
  (s:StudyValue)-[:HAS_STUDY_VISIT]->
  (visit:StudyVisit)-[:STUDY_VISIT_HAS_SCHEDULE]->
  (:StudyActivitySchedule)<-[:STUDY_ACTIVITY_HAS_SCHEDULE]-
  (s_act:StudyActivity)-[:STUDY_ACTIVITY_HAS_STUDY_ACTIVITY_SUBGROUP]->
  (:StudyActivitySubGroup)-[:HAS_SELECTED_ACTIVITY_SUBGROUP]->
  (asgv:ActivitySubGroupValue)-[:HAS_GROUP]->
  (sg:ActivityValidGroup)-[:IN_GROUP]->
  (:ActivityGroupValue),(s_act)-[:HAS_SELECTED_ACTIVITY]->
  (p_act:ActivityValue)
WHERE asgv.name = "Antibodies"
WITH DISTINCT s, visit, s_act,p_act
MATCH
  (s_act)-[:HAS_SELECTED_ACTIVITY]->
  (p_act:ActivityValue)-[:HAS_GROUPING]->
  (g:ActivityGrouping)<-[:HAS_ACTIVITY]-
  (p_ai:ActivityInstanceValue)<-[:HAS_SELECTED_ACTIVITY_INSTANCE]-
  (:StudyActivityInstance)<-[:HAS_STUDY_ACTIVITY_INSTANCE]-
  (:StudyValue)-[:HAS_STUDY_VISIT]->
  (visit:StudyVisit)
WITH DISTINCT s, visit, p_act, p_ai
CALL {
  WITH s, visit, p_act, p_ai
  OPTIONAL MATCH (p_ai)-[:CONTAINS_ACTIVITY_ITEM]->(p_aitm1:ActivityItem)
  WITH DISTINCT p_aitm1
  OPTIONAL MATCH
    (p_aitm1)-[:HAS_UNIT_DEFINITION]->
    (:UnitDefinitionRoot)-[:LATEST]->
    (p_unitdef:UnitDefinitionValue)
  RETURN collect(DISTINCT p_unitdef.name) AS unitcoll
}
CALL {
  WITH s, visit, p_act, p_ai
  OPTIONAL MATCH
    (p_ai)-[:CONTAINS_ACTIVITY_ITEM]->
    (p_aitm1:ActivityItem)<--
    (:ActivityItemClassRoot)-[:LATEST]->
    (:ActivityItemClassValue {name: "specimen"})
  WITH DISTINCT p_aitm1
  OPTIONAL MATCH
  (p_aitm1)-[:HAS_CT_TERM]->
  (:CTTermContext)-[:HAS_SELECTED_TERM]->
  (:CTTermRoot)<-[:HAS_TERM_ROOT]-(subm_val1:CTCodelistTerm)
  RETURN subm_val1.submission_value AS lbspec
}
CALL {
  WITH s, visit, p_act, p_ai
  OPTIONAL MATCH
    (p_ai)-[:CONTAINS_ACTIVITY_ITEM]->
    (p_aitm2:ActivityItem)<--
    (:ActivityItemClassRoot)-[:LATEST]->
    (:ActivityItemClassValue {name: "method"})
  WITH DISTINCT p_aitm2
  OPTIONAL MATCH
    (p_aitm2)-[:HAS_CT_TERM]->
    (:CTTermContext)-[:HAS_SELECTED_TERM]->
    (:CTTermRoot)<-[:HAS_TERM_ROOT]-(subm_val2:CTCodelistTerm)
  RETURN subm_val2.submission_value AS lbmethod
}
CALL {
  WITH s, visit, p_act, p_ai
  OPTIONAL MATCH
    (p_ai)-[:CONTAINS_ACTIVITY_ITEM]->
    (p_aitm3:ActivityItem)<--
    (:ActivityItemClassRoot)-[:LATEST]->
    (:ActivityItemClassValue {name: "original_result"})
  WITH DISTINCT p_aitm3
  OPTIONAL MATCH
    (p_aitm3)-[:HAS_CT_TERM]->
    (:CTTermContext)-[:HAS_SELECTED_TERM]->
    (:CTTermRoot)<-[:HAS_TERM_ROOT]-(subm_val3:CTCodelistTerm)
  RETURN collect(DISTINCT subm_val3.submission_value) AS lbstresc
}
WITH
  p_act,
  unitcoll,
  p_ai,
lbstresc,
  CASE
    WHEN size(lbmethod) > 0 THEN lbmethod
    ELSE 'To be provided'
  END AS lbmethod,
  CASE
    WHEN size(lbspec) > 0 THEN lbspec
    ELSE 'To be provided'
  END AS lbspec
  RETURN DISTINCT p_act.name AS `Assessment description based on protocol`,
  'To be provided' AS `Supplier Assessment`,
  'To be provided' AS `Supplier Unit`,
  'To be provided' AS `Supplier Method Name`,
  unitcoll AS UNITCOLL,
  lbspec AS SPEC,
  p_ai.topic_code AS TOPICCD,
  lbstresc AS  `If result is categorical, specify valid ORRES values from categorical response list`,
  lbmethod AS METHOD

styleRules.field: If result is categorical, specify valid ORRES values from categorical response list

reports.title: Study selected
reports.query:
MATCH (n0:StudyRoot {uid:$neodash_studyroot_uid})-[r1:LATEST]->(n1:StudyValue)
WITH CASE WHEN (n1.study_number is not null and n1.study_acronym is not null) THEN (n1.study_id_prefix + '-'+n1.study_number+ " [" + n1.study_acronym + "]") ELSE CASE WHEN n1.study_acronym is null THEN (n1.study_id_prefix + '-'+n1.study_number) ELSE (n1.study_id_prefix + " [" + n1.study_acronym + "]") END END AS Value
RETURN DISTINCT Value

reports.title: Spec Version selected
reports.query: return $neodash_lab_specification_version
